Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Jar
Description: Jar with a spherical body and a wide orifice with a fat lip of triangular profile. A carefully executed decoration, incised on the shoulder in the already dried clay, was applied using a fine tool: triangles filled with lines, tips facing. Several examples of this type of vessel were always placed in Middle Kerma burials. They represent one of the elements used for dating this phase.
